articles.author: Wahed Shaik
articles.description:
Hi Devs üëã,
I‚Äôm working on Foodstagram, a social platform for discovering restaurants through community-driven reviews, photos, and foodie profiles ‚Äî kind of like a blend of Yelp and Instagram, but food-focused üç£üì∑.
Right now, I‚Äôve got a super basic prototype built on Bubble, and it‚Äôs costing me around $40/month to keep it running.
I‚Äôm debating between:
Continuing with Bubble for faster development and iteration
Switching to a coded stack (e.g., React, Express, MongoDB) for more flexibility and scalability
I do have some coding experience, but time and team resources are tight. My main goal is to launch fast, test with real users, and eventually scale if things go well.
What would you recommend?
Thanks in advance üôå
‚Äî Wahed
articles.title: Should I Keep Building My Social Food App on Bubble or Switch to Code?

articles.author: Generatecode
articles.description:
When managing Gradle projects, particularly those involving Kotlin, it's common to encounter the scenario where both a Gradle plugin and a dependency rely on the same version number. The question arises: how can you define a single variable that is accessible for both a plugin and a dependency in your build.gradle file?
Why This Issue Occurs
Gradle creates different scopes for different parts of the build configuration. The buildscript block is used to define classpath dependencies for the Gradle build itself, and variables defined there (like ext.kotlinVersion) aren't directly accessible in the dependencies block. This can lead to redundancy if the same version number needs to be specified in multiple places.
To overcome this limitation and avoid repetitive definitions, Kotlin users can f‚Ä¶
articles.title: How to Use a Single Variable for Plugin and Dependency Versions in Gradle

articles.description: Learn how to effectively manage your WordPress site's settings with the powerful Options API. articles.title: Demystifying the WordPress Options API: Storing and Retrieving Your Site‚Äôs Settings

articles.author: Roman Makuev
articles.description:
Let‚Äôs be real: when you land on a website or open an app, you judge it in a heartbeat. Cluttered layouts, garish colors, or confusing navigation? You‚Äôre out the door before you even read the first sentence. But a sleek, minimalistic design that‚Äôs easy on the eyes? That‚Äôs the kind of vibe that makes you stick around, trust the brand, and maybe even hit that ‚ÄúBuy Now‚Äù button. As a UX designer who‚Äôs spent years obsessing over what makes digital experiences click, I‚Äôve seen firsthand how aesthetic, minimalistic design isn‚Äôt just a trend‚Äîit‚Äôs a game-changer for building trust and driving conversions.
In this deep dive, I‚Äôll unpack the science, share real-world examples, and toss in some charts to show why less really is more when it comes to designing websites and apps. With the right approach‚Äî‚Ä¶
articles.title: Trust & Conversion: The Minimalist Design Advantage in Web & App Development

articles.author: Giorgio Boa
articles.description:
Generative AI models possess the remarkable ability to generate human-quality text, code, images, and more, opening up a vast array of possibilities across diverse industries.
AI hallucinations refer to instances where these models produce outputs that are factually incorrect, nonsensical, or completely fabricated, despite appearing coherent and plausible.
This phenomenon poses a major challenge to the reliability and trustworthiness of generative AI, hindering its widespread adoption in critical applications.
LLMs are trained on massive datasets of text and code, learning to identify patterns and relationships between words and concepts.  While this training enables them to generate impressive text, it doesn't necessarily equip them with a true understanding of the real world.
Here's a br‚Ä¶
articles.title: A special secret to prevent AI hallucinations with a practical Google genkit-ai example!

articles.author: Your's Nightmare
articles.description:
Antivirus in the Modern Age ‚Äî Still Relevant?


Many people think antivirus software is outdated in today‚Äôs age of advanced operating systems, built-in firewalls, and AI-driven threat detection. But is it really safe to go without it in 2025?
Let‚Äôs break it down.
Cyber threats today are far more sophisticated than in the past. Malware isn't just about viruses anymore ‚Äî it's about:
Ransomware locking entire networks
Spyware silently stealing your data
Trojan horse pretending to be legit software
Zero-day attacks exploiting unknown vulnerabilities
Built-in tools like Windows Defender do offer basic protection, but they're not foolproof against complex and targeted threats.
Yes, staying cautious online helps ‚Äî like not clicking suspicious links or downloading pirated software. But even the sm‚Ä¶
articles.title: Do You Really Need Antivirus in This Modern Digital Era? Let‚Äôs Find Out

articles.author: phoenix
articles.description:
Codable Macros Make Swift Serialization So Simple!


Hello everyone! As Swift developers, we deal with data every day, and the conversion between JSON and models is undoubtedly a daily task. Apple provided us with the Codable protocol, which performs well in many situations, but as business logic becomes more complex, we often find ourselves stuck writing a lot of boilerplate code: manually defining CodingKeys, implementing init(from:) and encode(to:), handling nested structures, dealing with different naming styles, parsing various date formats... These tedious tasks are not only time-consuming but also error-prone.
Is there a more elegant and efficient way to handle Codable in Swift?
The answer is definitely yes! With Swift Macros introduced in Swift 5.9+, the possibilities for code gene‚Ä¶
articles.title: Codable Macros Make Swift Serialization So Simple!

articles.author: Ankit Kumar
articles.description:
üß† The Wake-Up Call


Last week, I read about Cursor's AI support bot confidently inventing a non-existent company policy. It caused public outrage.
But for me? It wasn‚Äôt even surprising.
As a Software developer working on enterprise systems, I‚Äôve seen that kind of AI ‚Äúconfidence‚Äù firsthand ‚Äî not in chat replies, but in code.
It looked right. It passed some tests.
üß® Boom. Production bug.
The worst part? The AI didn‚Äôt know it was wrong. And neither did I‚Ä¶ until it was too late.
I was an early adopter of GitHub Copilot, ChatGPT, and all the latest AI dev tools.
Faster development?
Fewer repetitive tasks?
More time for ‚Äúreal‚Äù problem solving?
At first, it felt like magic.
Over time, the bugs started creeping in. And they weren‚Äôt obvious ones.
Here‚Äôs what I ran into:
üîê Authentication flows t‚Ä¶
articles.title: üöÄFixing AI Code with Model-Based Testing: A Developer's Tale

articles.author: Andrew Morrison
articles.description:
Seamless communication is more than a luxury‚Äîit's a necessity. As remote work becomes mainstream and hybrid offices continue to thrive, the tools that enable collaboration must evolve to meet the demands of modern teams. One platform, in particular, stands out for revolutionizing how we interact at work: Slack. More than just a messaging app, Slack has matured into a dynamic ecosystem of communication tools that drive productivity, foster real-time collaboration, and shape inclusive work environments.
The Evolution of Workplace Communication
Historically, teams relied on email for most business communication. While email still plays a role, its limitations‚Äîdelayed responses, difficulty managing threads, and lack of real-time interaction‚Äîmake it less ideal for fast-moving projects. As teams‚Ä¶
articles.title: How Slack Communication Tools Are Redefining Team Collaboration

articles.author: Anene Emmanuel Anyibuofu
articles.description:
Getting Started with Your Azure Playground
So, you're taking your first steps in the world of Microsoft Azure? Awesome! One of the very first things you'll encounter is the idea of a Virtual Network, or VNet.
Think of a VNet as your very own secure and isolated network right there in the cloud. It's the dedicated space where all your Azure goodies ‚Äì things like virtual machines, databases, and web applications ‚Äì can chat and work together safely. In this friendly guide, I'll show you how to build and set up your own VNet using the Azure Portal. No need to be a command-line whiz here ‚Äì we'll do it all with clicks!
Ready to jump in?
üí° Why Bother with Virtual Networks?
When you start launching resources in Azure, you don't want them just hanging out in the open, do you? A VNet acts like a se‚Ä¶
articles.title: Creating Your Own Private Cloud Space: An Easy Guide to Azure Virtual Networks (via the Azure Portal)

articles.author: Generatecode
articles.description:
Introduction
It's common to face UI positioning issues when developing applications in Kotlin, especially when working with camera views and dynamic layouts. If you‚Äôre finding that your camera view is opening in the upper left corner despite being assigned a Positioned widget with specific coordinates, you're not alone. Let's dive into the potential causes of this issue and explore solutions together.
Understanding the Issue
The camera view in your Flutter app should ideally be confined to a specific area defined by the Positioned widget. However, many developers encounter scenarios where views don't render in the expected locations. This can happen due to several reasons, including:
Incorrect layout constraints.
Misconfigured AnimatedPositioned properties.
Overlapping layouts without clea‚Ä¶
articles.title: How to Fix Camera Positioning Issues in Kotlin Apps?

articles.author: Vehbi Sinan Tunalioglu
articles.description:
I bumped into an annoying issue today while upgrading my Python dependencies in a codebase. And I thought it would be a good idea to share the solution with you. Thanks to Nix for making this kind of fix so straightforward.
Admittedly, learning and getting used to Nix may take a while. But once you get the hang of it, you will be amazed by its power, flexibility and reliability. When I say reliability, I mean it: You can rely on Nix to look after you when you drop your guard.
Let me show you how Nix can help you patch a Python package without having to pin your package to a specific but unreleased commit from upstream or maintaining a fork of it, and give you a bit of further reassurance that your patch is not going to break anything else in your codebase.
I am maintaining a Python codebas‚Ä¶
articles.title: Why and How to Patch a Python Package in Nix

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Nancy Lubale
articles.description:
Key takeaways:

Ether breaks multimonth downtrend as traders target $3,000 ETH price.

Ethereum TVL surges 41% to $52.8 billion in 30 days, with a 22% rise in daily transactions to 1.34 million, signaling strong network recovery.

Technicals show ETH price faces major resistance at $2,100-$2,800.

Ether is setting up for a recovery toward the $3,000 psychological level, backed by recovering network activity, increasing TVL, and strong technicals.¬†
Ether price seeks a return to $3K
Ether (ETH) looks to end its downtrend that has been in play since mid-December after it turned away from its 10-month high of $4,100.
Crypto technical analyst Mikybull Crypto shared a chart showing the ETH price breaking above a six-month descending trendline, with $2,000 and $2,250 being key resistance levels t‚Ä¶
articles.title: Ethereum price finally ‚Äòbreaking out,‚Äô data suggests ‚Äî Is $3K ETH next?

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Dilip Kumar Patairya
articles.description:
What is ‚ÄãVanEck's Onchain Economy ETF ($NODE)            
            
                
VanEck‚Äôs Onchain Economy ETF ($NODE) exposes investors to companies driving blockchain adoption across multiple industries. The fund is scheduled to begin trading on May 14, 2025, following its inception on May 13, 2025.
As the global economy shifts to a digital core, NODE offers active equity investment in real-world companies shaping that future. This ETF is actively managed, meaning a portfolio manager and not just an algorithm, selects the included stocks.
The ETF may allocate up to 25% of its assets to crypto-linked exchange-traded products (ETPs) via a Cayman Islands subsidiary, providing indirect exposure to digital assets while adhering to US tax regulations. With a management fee of 0.69%, $NOD‚Ä¶
articles.title: What is VanEck‚Äôs Onchain Economy ETF ($NODE) and how does it work?

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Amin Haqshanas
articles.description:
Space and Time, a blockchain project supported by Microsoft, has launched its public, permissionless mainnet to bring zero-knowledge (ZK)-proven data infrastructure to crypto applications.
Built by MakeInfinite Labs, Space and Time offers a decentralized, verifiable database for smart contracts to query historical, crosschain and offchain data, according to a news release shared with Cointelegraph.
The platform indexes data from major networks like Ethereum and makes it accessible through a decentralized network of validators. Developers can query this data using Space and Time‚Äôs Proof of SQL ‚Äî a sub-second ZK coprocessor that delivers cryptographic proofs with every query.
‚ÄúPrior to Space and Time, onchain applications had no way to query basic user data from a database of blockchain acti‚Ä¶
articles.title: Microsoft-backed Space and Time mainnet launches with major builders

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Ezra Reguerra
articles.description:
Doodles‚Äô non-fungible token (NFTs) sales surged by 97% in the last 24 hours as digital collectible traders anticipate the project‚Äôs token generation event and airdrop.¬†
On May 8, data from CryptoSlam showed Doodles NFT sales topping $1.1 million, nearly doubling the previous day‚Äôs total. The spike placed Doodles in the third spot for daily NFT sales, following DMarket and Courtyard NFTs.
Over the past week, Doodles recorded $2.6 million in total sales volume, up 368% from the week prior and ranking fifth among all NFT collections, according to CryptoSlam.
The surge comes ahead of the launch of Doodles‚Äô long-awaited DOOD token. The project announced on May 7 that the token generation event will take place on May 9.
Source: Doodles
Doodles to launch DOOD token and airdrop¬†
Doodles announced ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Doodles NFT sales surge 97% ahead of DOOD token airdrop

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Adrian Zmudzinski
articles.description:
The Ethereum Pectra upgrade introduced a significant upgrade in account abstraction accessibility, with multiple wallets already implementing the change.
Pectra introduced Ethereum Improvement Proposal (EIP) 7702, a change that Ivo Georgiev, founder and CEO of self-custodial smart wallet Ambire, described as ‚Äúthe single greatest UX upgrade to Ethereum so far.‚Äù Ambire is among the wallet providers that have already rolled out support for the new features since Pectra went live yesterday.
Ambire‚Äôs announcement shared with Cointelegraph explains that EIP-7702 brings smart account functionality to existing user accounts, letting them temporarily act as smart contracts. This results in the advantages of account abstraction being accessible without creating new dedicated onchain addresses, rende‚Ä¶
articles.title: Pectra features already in use: Ethereum EIP-7702 wallets roll out

articles.author: Cointelegraph by William Suberg
articles.description:
Key points:

Bitcoin‚Äôs realized cap is beating records and has almost reached the $900 billion mark.

The market is laying the foundations for a ‚Äúpotentially significant price breakout,‚Äù new analysis says.

Profit-taking is not hindering the overall bull market rebound.

Bitcoin (BTC) is setting new all-time highs in network value as BTC price action eyes a return to six figures.
Data from onchain analytics platform CryptoQuant confirms new record highs for Bitcoin‚Äôs realized cap.
Bitcoin realized cap reflects ‚Äúgrowing conviction‚Äù
Bitcoin is worth more than ever in US dollar terms if its market cap is measured by the value at which the extant supply last moved onchain.
Known as realized cap, this figure has seen continued all-time highs since mid-April as BTC/USD stages a sustained recover‚Ä¶
articles.title: New bull cycle? Bitcoin's return to $100K hints at ‚Äòsignificant price move‚Äô

Key takeaways:

The crypto market is up 2.5% on May 8, with its capitalization above $3 trillion for the first time in over eight weeks.¬†

Fed's steady rates and stagflation fears boost Bitcoin as a store of value.

Anticipated US-UK trade deal and a technical rebound fuel market optimism.

The cryptocurrency market is up today, with the total market capitalization rising by approximately 2.5% in the last 24 hours to reach $3.06 trillion on May 8.¬†
Today‚Äôs gains were led by Bitcoin (BTC) and Ether (ETH), which have risen around 2.3% and 4%, respectively.
Crypto market performance May 8. Source: Coin360
Stagflation fears ‚Äúgood‚Äù for crypto assets
The Federal Reserve‚Äôs decision to keep interest rates steady at 4.25%-4.50% on May 7 has bolstered crypto‚Äôs appeal. Fed Chair Jerome Powell‚Äôs post-‚Ä¶
articles.title: Why is the crypto market up today?

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Bradley Peak
articles.description:
Is your gaming PC capable of mining crypto?            
            
                
As of May 2025, Bitcoin mining is looking attractive again. With Bitcoin (BTC) trading around $95,000 and transaction fees hitting new highs after the 2024 halving, mining rewards ‚Äî though smaller ‚Äî are worth chasing. From home setups to industrial-scale farms, the question of whether Bitcoin mining is profitable is back in the spotlight.
And if you‚Äôre a gamer, chances are you‚Äôve looked at your rig and wondered: Can a gaming PC mine crypto? After all, modern gaming computers are packed with powerful GPUs, solid cooling and lots of downtime, especially if you‚Äôre not gaming daily. It‚Äôs a fair question: Can you mine Bitcoin with a gaming PC?
The short answer: Yes, but it won‚Äôt be worth it.¬†
The long answer:¬†‚Ä¶
articles.title: Can you mine Bitcoin with a gaming PC? Here‚Äôs what you need to know

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Ezra Reguerra
articles.description:
Almost 60,000 Bitcoin addresses tied to LockBit‚Äôs ransomware infrastructure were leaked after hackers breached the group‚Äôs dark web affiliate panel.¬†
The leak included a MySQL database dump shared publicly online. It contained crypto-related information that could help blockchain analysts trace the group‚Äôs illicit financial flows.  
Ransomware is a type of malware used by malicious actors. It locks its target‚Äôs files or computer systems, making them inaccessible. The attackers typically demand a ransom payment, often in digital assets like Bitcoin (BTC), in exchange for a decryption key to unlock the files.
LockBit is one of the most notorious crypto ransomware groups. In February 2024, 10 countries launched a joint operation to disrupt the group, saying that the organization had caused bi‚Ä¶
articles.title: 60K Bitcoin addresses leaked as LockBit ransomware gang gets hacked

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Amin Haqshanas
articles.description:
David Bailey, CEO of crypto media company BTC Inc. and a close adviser to US President Donald Trump on digital assets, has reportedly raised $300 million to launch a new Bitcoin investment firm.
The venture, named Nakamoto after the pseudonymous creator of Bitcoin, Satoshi Nakamoto, aims to become a publicly traded company focused on acquiring and holding the cryptocurrency, CNBC reported, citing people familiar with the matter. The Information¬†was first to cover the story.
The funding round, which has been quietly in motion since January, includes $200 million in equity and $100 million in convertible debt, a source familiar with the matter told CNBC.
While the firm has not officially announced the raise, an official reveal and merger with a Nasdaq-listed company is expected as early as n‚Ä¶
articles.title: Trump crypto adviser David Bailey raises $300M for Bitcoin investment firm

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Stephen Katte
articles.description:
The US Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (OCC) has confirmed banks under its jurisdiction can trade crypto on behalf of customers and outsource some crypto activities to third parties.¬†
Acting comptroller Rodney Hood said in a May 7 letter that banks and federal savings associations can buy and sell crypto they hold in custody at customers‚Äô direction.
The OCC added in a press release that financial institutions can also outsource bank-permissible crypto activities, including custody and execution services, to third parties in compliance with applicable law.
‚ÄúAdditionally, these banks may provide other custody services, including record keeping, tax or reporting services for their customers,‚Äù Hood said in a May 7 video posted to X.¬†

OCC-regulated banks may buy and sell assets held ‚Ä¶
articles.title: US banks can handle customer crypto assets held in custody, regulator confirms

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Martin Young
articles.description:
Group of Seven (G7) leaders could discuss North Korea‚Äôs escalating cyberattacks and crypto thefts at an upcoming summit in Canada, mid-next month.
Conflicts in Ukraine and Gaza will dominate discussions, but North Korea‚Äôs increasing cyber threats and crypto hacks have become a major concern requiring a coordinated international response, Bloomberg reported on May 7, citing people familiar with the plans.
The people said North Korea‚Äôs nefarious cyber operations are alarming, as the stolen crypto has become a key funding source for the regime and its programs.¬†
North Korean-affiliated hacking groups such as the Lazarus Group have already stolen billions of dollars worth of crypto this year, including pulling off the $1.4 billion hack on Bybit in February, the largest ever for the crypto indu‚Ä¶
articles.title: G7 summit could discuss North Korea‚Äôs crypto hacks: Report

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Ciaran Lyons
articles.description:
Bitcoiners expect Bitcoin to soon break past $100,000 and potentially hit a new all-time high as US President Donald Trump is set to announce a trade deal with the UK.
Trump said in a May 7 Truth Social post that a ‚Äúmajor trade deal‚Äù with a ‚Äúbig, and highly respected, country‚Äù would be announced on May 8, which The New York Times reported would be the UK, citing three people familiar with the plans.
Bitcoin inches toward $100,000
When Trump published his post, Bitcoin (BTC) was trading at around $97,759 and has since crept up closer to the psychological $100,000 price level to trade at $99,140 at the time of publication, according to CoinMarketCap data.
Bitcoin is trading at $99,140 at the time of publication. Source: CoinMarketCap
Several Bitcoiners and analysts are crediting the rally to‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin nears $100K as Trump set to reveal trade deal with UK

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Brayden Lindrea
articles.description:
A Texas House Committee has passed a Republican-backed bill to create a Bitcoin reserve, which now only needs a successful full floor vote before heading to the governor‚Äôs desk.
The Texas House Committee on Delivery of Government Efficiency passed Senate Bill 21 with no amendments on May 7 in a 9-4 vote along party lines. The bill has already passed the Texas Senate, in a 25-5 vote on March 6.  
SB 21 would establish the ‚ÄúTexas Strategic Bitcoin Reserve,‚Äù controlled by the state‚Äôs comptroller ‚Äî currently Glenn Hegar ‚Äî who would be permitted to invest in digital assets that have obtained a market cap of at least $500 billion over the last twelve months, which would currently only include Bitcoin (BTC).
Source: Pierre Rochard

Republican Senator Charles Schwertner initially introduced SB 21 ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Texas House committee passes Bitcoin reserve bill for full floor vote

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Ciaran Lyons
articles.description:
Bitcoin has reclaimed $98,000 for the first time in almost three months after the US Federal Reserve said it would keep interest rates the same for another month.
The Fed‚Äôs decision to keep interest rates unchanged comes despite mounting pressure from US President Donald Trump, who just weeks ago threatened to fire Fed chair Jerome Powell for being ‚Äútoo late‚Äù in cutting rates.
Fed cites higher unemployment, inflation risk
Powell said on May 7 that the Federal Reserve rate-setting committee held rates in the 4.25% to 4.50% range due to the rising risks of higher unemployment and higher inflation.
He added inflation has ‚Äúcome down a great deal but has been running above our 2% longer objective.‚Äù Powell said surveys in households and businesses showed a ‚Äúsharp decline in sentiment‚Äù mainly due‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin returns to $98K as Fed holds rates steady despite Trump‚Äôs demand

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Stephen Katte
articles.description:
Nasdaq-listed Bitcoin mining firm Core Scientific Inc. posted a net profit of $580 million with its first quarter results, but missed analyst revenue estimates after a drop in its mining profits.
Core Scientific‚Äôs Q1 2025 results, published on May 7, saw it more than double its $210 million net income from the year-ago quarter, while its total revenue reached $79.5 million, missing Zacks analysts' estimates by 8.11%, and falling from its $179.3 million in revenues for Q1 2024.¬†
The firm‚Äôs primary source of revenue came from $67.2 million in self-mining revenue, $3.8 million in hosted mining revenue, and $8.6 million in colocation, formerly listed as high-performance computing (HPC) hosting.
Source: Core Scientific
Core Scientific said its drop in Bitcoin (BTC) mined and revenue was due to ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin miner Core Scientific posts $580M Q1 profit but misses revenue estimates

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Brayden Lindrea
articles.description:
Arizona Governor Katie Hobbs has signed a bill into law allowing the US state to keep unclaimed crypto and establish a ‚ÄúBitcoin Reserve Fund‚Äù that won‚Äôt use any taxpayer money or state funds.
Hobbs signed House Bill 2749 into law on May 7, which allows Arizona to claim ownership of abandoned digital assets if the owner fails to respond to communications within three years.
The state‚Äôs custodians can stake the crypto to earn rewards or receive airdrops, which can then be deposited into what Arizona has called a Bitcoin and Digital Asset Reserve Fund.
‚ÄúThis law ensures Arizona doesn‚Äôt leave value sitting on the table and puts us in a position to lead the country in how we secure, manage, and ultimately benefit from abandoned digital currency,‚Äù the bill‚Äôs sponsor, Jeff Weninger, said in a May‚Ä¶
articles.title: Arizona governor signs law for state to keep unclaimed crypto

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Brayden Lindrea
articles.description:
Binance founder and convicted felon Changpeng Zhao says that he applied for a pardon from US President Donald Trump shortly after denying reports that he was seeking one.
Zhao, also known as CZ, said on a Farokh Radio podcast episode aired May 6 that he ‚Äúwouldn‚Äôt mind‚Äù a pardon and that his lawyers have already filed the paperwork on his behalf
‚ÄúI got lawyers applying,‚Äù Zhao said, adding that he submitted the request after Bloomberg and The Wall Street Journal reported in March that he was seeking a pardon from Trump amid discussions of a business deal between the Trump family and Binance.US.
Zhao denied the reports at the time, but said on the podcast that he thought ‚Äúif they‚Äôre writing this article, I may as well just officially apply.‚Äù
He added that Trump‚Äôs pardon of three BitMEX founde‚Ä¶
articles.title: Binance founder CZ Zhao asked Trump to pardon money laundering conviction

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Cointelegraph
articles.description:
Today in crypto, Arizona‚Äôs Governor signed a ‚ÄúBitcoin Reserve Fund‚Äù into law, Robinhood plans a blockchain for tokenized securities offering in Europe, and Ethereum‚Äôs Pectra upgrade is live, bringing smart accounts and other features.
Arizona gets a crypto stockpile
Arizona Governor Katie Hobbs signed a bill into law on May 7 that allows the state to keep  crypto that‚Äôs been unclaimed for at least three years to put into a ‚ÄúBitcoin and Digital Assets Reserve Fund.‚Äù
House Bill 2749 allows Arizona to claim ownership of abandoned digital assets if the owner fails to respond to communications within three years. The state‚Äôs custodians can stake the crypto to earn rewards or get airdrops.
House Representative Jeff Weninger, who sponsored the bill, said it ‚Äúensures Arizona doesn‚Äôt leave value si‚Ä¶
articles.title: Here‚Äôs what happened in crypto today

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Vince Quill
articles.description:
Stripe, a global payments platform, has introduced stablecoin-based accounts to clients in over 100 countries. 
According to a May 7 announcement, the new feature will allow the platform's clients "to send, receive, and hold US-dollar stablecoin account balances, similar to how a traditional fiat bank account works."
The product's technical page shows that the new account feature will support Circle's USDC (USDC) and Bridge's USDB (USDB) stablecoins. Stripe acquired the Bridge platform in October 2024.
The product will be available to clients in more than 100 countries, including Argentina, Chil√©, Turkey, Colombia, and Peru, among others.
Stripe's newly launched product comes at a time when stablecoins are increasingly seen as stores of value in developing economies struggling with high in‚Ä¶
articles.title: Stripe rolls out stablecoin accounts in over 100 countries

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Christopher Tepedino
articles.description:
Brokerage fintech Robinhood is reportedly developing a blockchain network that will enable retail investors in Europe to trade US securities.
According to a May 7 Bloomberg report citing sources familiar with the matter, the move seeks to expand the company's local presence by offering trading of tokenized securities, such as stocks. 
Two crypto firms, Arbitrum and the Solana Foundation, are reportedly vying to become partners in the project. Tokenization is the process of turning real-world assets, like stocks, real estate, or commodities, into digital tokens that can be traded on a blockchain.
Tokenizing securities instead of providing direct exposure can offer several advantages: reduced costs by eliminating traditional financial infrastructure, enhanced accessibility, faster settlement‚Ä¶
articles.title: Robinhood plans blockchain for US asset trading in Europe: Report

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Marie Poteriaieva
articles.description:
What to know:

Lyn Alden says a weaker dollar is necessary for the US to stabilize its financial system.

Bitcoin and gold are well-positioned to benefit from de-dollarization.

Sovereign wealth funds and various nations are already increasing their Bitcoin exposure as the dollar‚Äôs global dominance starts to wane.

The weakening of the US dollar (DXY) is no longer headline news. With mounting disruptions across the US economy, a declining greenback has become part of the backdrop. Since the start of 2025, the US Dollar Index has dropped 11%, now hovering around levels last seen in April 2022. Markets have largely responded with a shrug. After all, in times of deep restructuring, isn‚Äôt some dollar weakness to be expected?
The trouble is, this might not be a temporary dip. The dollar‚Äôs slide‚Ä¶
articles.title: Falling DXY part of US financial system‚Äôs ‚Äòlong-term transition‚Äô ‚Äî Will Bitcoin continue to shine?

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Turner Wright
articles.description:
Braden John Karony, the former CEO of crypto firm SafeMoon, made an out-of-court statement claiming innocence as his criminal trial began in New York.
In a May 6 X post after court proceedings had likely ended for the day, Karony said he was innocent and ‚Äúdid not commit fraud‚Äù in response to media coverage of his trial. The former CEO, as well as SafeMoon creator Kyle Nagy and former chief technology officer Thomas Smith, were charged in 2023 for having allegedly ‚Äúdiverted and misappropriated millions of dollars‚Äô worth‚Äù of the platform‚Äôs SFM token.
According to reporting from the US District Court for the Eastern District of New York (EDNY) on May 6, Karony implied that Nagy, who reportedly fled to Russia after authorities filed charges, was responsible for some of the alleged fraud at Saf‚Ä¶
articles.title: Ex-SafeMoon CEO claims innocence, blames founder as trial begins

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Alex O‚ÄôDonnell
articles.description:
Binance-affiliated BNB Chain has rebounded after a period of stagnation in 2023 amid accelerating institutional and decentralized finance (DeFi) adoption.¬†
During the past year, BNB Chain has benefited from multibillion-dollar inflows into DeFi, US exchange-traded funds (ETFs), and rising trading volume at affiliated centralized exchange (CEX) Binance.¬†
Consequently, the blockchain network‚Äôs native BNB token (BNB) has emerged as among the market‚Äôs most resilient cryptocurrencies, surpassing all-time highs in the first quarter of 2025 even as the broader crypto market trended downward.¬†
‚ÄúThis resilience isn't just about price action ‚Äî strong fundamentals also back it,‚Äù Joao Wedson, CEO of investing analytics platform Alphractal, said in an April X post.¬†‚ÄúBinance has built a massive ecosyste‚Ä¶
articles.title: Binance‚Äôs BNB Chain rebounds amid institutional, DeFi adoption

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Marcel Pechman
articles.description:
Key takeaways:

Reclaiming the $2,200 level remains the first price challenge for ETH.¬†

ETH price could recover if the Pectra upgrade leads to a surge in DApp and Ethereum network activity.¬†

Ethereum successfully implemented a key network upgrade on May 7, but Ether (ETH) price and its derivatives metrics showed little response to the upgrade. The lackluster response surprised traders and led analysts to question whether ETH still has a real chance of climbing 22% to retake the $2,200 level.
Ether 30-day futures annualized premium. Source: Laevitas.ch
The ETH futures premium has remained below the 5% neutral threshold, indicating a lack of appetite from leveraged bulls. More significantly, this indicator was unchanged at 3% after the Pectra upgrade, suggesting traders did not adjust thei‚Ä¶
articles.title: Ethereum Pectra upgrade adds new features ‚Äî How long before ETH price reacts?

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Vince Quill
articles.description:
Onchain sleuth and security analyst ZachXBT claims to have identified an additional $45 million in funds stolen from Coinbase users through social engineering scams in the past seven days alone.
According to the onchain detective, the $45 million figure represents the latest financial losses in a string of social engineering scams targeting Coinbase users, which ZachXBT said is a problem unique among crypto exchanges:
"Over the past few months, I have reported on nine figures stolen from Coinbase users via similar social engineering scams. Interestingly, no other major exchange has the same problem."
Cointelegraph reached out to Coinbase but was unable to get a response by the time of publication.
Source: ZachXBT
The claims made by ZachXBT place the total amount lost by Coinbase users to s‚Ä¶
articles.title: $45 million stolen from Coinbase users in the last week ‚Äî ZachXBT

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Turner Wright
articles.description:
Speaking at a hearing, US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent suggested support for two crypto-related bills moving through Congress.
Bessent addressed lawmakers at a May 7 hearing of the House Financial Services Committee, saying that the United States should be the ‚Äúpremier destination for digital assets‚Äù in response to a question about American dominance over China in crypto-related innovation. The Treasury Secretary added that ‚Äúgood market structure‚Äù and ‚Äústablecoin legislation‚Äù could help ensure this outcome.
US Treasury Secretary speaking at a May 7 hearing. Source: Scott Bessent
Bessent‚Äôs remarks echoed those of other Republican lawmakers and President Donald Trump, who initially claimed he wanted to make the US the ‚Äúcrypto capital of the world‚Äù during his 2024 campaign. 
The Treasury ‚Ä¶
articles.title: US Treasury Secretary expresses support for crypto bills at hearing

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Christopher Tepedino
articles.description:
Threat group COLDRIVER is using new malware to steal documents from Western targets, according to a May 7 report from Google Threat Intelligence. The malware, called LOSTKEYS, shows the evolution of the group from credential phishing to more sophisticated attacks.
According to the Google report, the new malware is installed through four steps. The process involves a ‚Äúlure website‚Äù with a fake CAPTCHA, a PowerShell script downloaded to the user‚Äôs clipboard, some device evasion, and retrieval of the final payload. Lastly, the malware is installed.
LOSTKEYS payload delivery. Source: Google
LOSTKEYS is capable of stealing files from extensions and directories. It can also send system information and running processes back to COLDRIVER. The address from which the parts of the attack come is ‚Äú16‚Ä¶
articles.title: COLDRIVER using new malware to steal from Western targets ‚Äî Google

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Biraajmaan Tamuly
articles.description:
Key Takeaways: 

Bitcoin‚Äôs realized capitalization hit a record $890 billion, reflecting strong investor conviction as long-term and short-term holders increased allocations. 

Large Bitcoin holders with over 1,000 BTC have accumulated significantly since March 2025, reflecting the Q1 2024 trend.

Bitcoin (BTC) price saw a short-squeeze above $97,000 on May 6, shortly after US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent announced that trade talks would commence with China on May 10. At the same time, BTC‚Äôs realized capitalization, a metric adding the dollar value of all coins at their last moved price, soared to a new all-time high of $890 billion on May 7, 2025. The surge also marks the metric‚Äôs third consecutive week of record-breaking growth.
Bitcoin realized cap. Source: CryptoQuant
The realized ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin ‚ÄòRealized Cap‚Äô hits $890B as BTC traders focus on recapturing $100K

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Alex O‚ÄôDonnell
articles.description:
Strive Asset Management, founded by entrepreneur and former presidential candidate Vivek Ramaswamy, has revealed plans to transition into a Bitcoin treasury company.
According to a May 7 announcement, Strive is going public through a reverse merger and plans to use the combined company‚Äôs stock to accumulate Bitcoin (BTC).
The deal will see Strive merging with Asset Entities, a social media marketing company listed on the Nasdaq. The combined entity will operate under the Strive brand and use its access to the public equity markets to finance Bitcoin purchases, the company said.¬†
Once the deal closes, Strive plans to issue approximately $1 billion in equity and debt and use the proceeds to accumulate BTC.¬†The asset manager ‚Äúintends to use all available mechanisms to build a Bitcoin war ches‚Ä¶
articles.title: Strive to become Bitcoin treasury company

articles.description: The Linux Foundation‚Äôs Decentralized Trust (LFDT) mentorship program is back in 2025 with two exciting opportunities for developers passionate about Ethereum, Android, and the Java Virtual Machine (JVM). Whether you‚Äôre a seasoned blockchain developer or an Android enthusiast eager to dive into Web3, these mentorships offer

November 2024 - April 2025
This report summarizes the activities and accomplishments of Web3j, an LF Decentralized Trust project, from November 2024 to April 2025.
